articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Palestinian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Palestinian President
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of greeting from Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas on Sunday.
					 The president in the message expressed regards, saying it is his pleasure to extend heartfelt congratulations and wishes to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the friendly government and people of the DPRK on behalf of the Palestinian people and on his own behalf on the occasion of the birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed thanks to Kim Jong Un for paying deep attention and extending support and solidarity to the just cause of the Palestinian people for terminating the occupation and building an independent state with East Kuds as its capital that has the right to self-determination.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un and people of the DPRK greater progress and prosperity.
					
					 He hoped for good health and happiness of Kim Jong Un and further development of the historic and friendly relations of solidarity between the two peoples.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday met and had a talk with a delegation of the Central Committee of the Fatherland Front of Vietnam led by President Huing Dam at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
					 Huing Dam asked Kim Yong Nam for delivering to the dear respected Kim Jong Un the greetings from, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam Nguyen Phu Trong, President Truong Tan Sang, Prime Minister Nguyen Tan Dung and Chairman of the National Assembly Nguyen Sinh Hung.
					
					 He noted that the Vietnamese people always remember the fact that the party, government and people of the DPRK positively supported and encouraged them in their struggle for national liberation and reunification of the country.
					
					 He wished the DPRK people greater success in building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 He also voiced conviction that the traditional ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries provided by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kim Il Sung would continue to grow.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Cuban Military Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Cuban Military Delegation
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the visiting military delegation of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba led by its Vice-Minister Joaquin Quintas Sola at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
					 The head of the delegation said that he cherishes deep respect and reverence for Marshal Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 He stressed that the Cuban people would always stand by the fraternal Korean people in the struggle against the common enemy.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Lao Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Lao Delegation
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with a delegation of the Commission for Propaganda and Training Affairs of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party led by Its Vice-Chairman Sisouk Philavong which paid a courtesy call on him on Monday.
					 The vice-chairman said that visiting several places, he witnessed the Korean people making achievements in socialist construction and came to know well about the invincible might of the DPRK. 
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and countries forged in their common struggle would continue to grow.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Heads of Delegations of Various Countries and Overseas Koreans
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Heads of Delegations of Various Countries, Overseas Koreans
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with the heads of the delegations of various countries and overseas Koreans on Monday. They are here to take part in the 8th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Chinese
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Chinese
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The dear respected     Kim Jong Un was presented with gifts by a delegation of the Association for Promotion of Development of Chinese Culture and a delegation of press officials of Jilin Province of China which are taking part in the 8th Pyongyang International Scientific and Technological Book Fair.
					 They were separately conveyed to officials concerned by Shi Yongqi, director of the Hua Yi Publishing House of China, and Dong Xiaowei, deputy director general of the Press and Publication Bureau, Jilin Province of China, who are heading the above-said delegations.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Lao and Chinese
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Lao, Chinese Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The dear respected      Kim Jong Un received gifts from the Commission for Propaganda and Training Affairs of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and the Liaoning Provincial Association for International Friendly Contact of China.
					 Vice-Chairman Sisouk Philavong, head of the delegation of the commission, handed over the gift to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, while Executive Vice-President Yang Junqiang, head of a delegation of the Liaoning Association for International Friendly Contact of China, conveyed it to an official concerned.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chief of Vietnamese Organization
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chief of Vietnamese Organization
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from Huing Dam, president of the Central Committee of the Fatherland Front of Vietnam, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, by Huing Dam on Monday.

articles.title: Kanji Inoki and His Party Tour Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kanji Inoki and His Party Tour Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Kanji Inoki, president of the Inoki Genom Joint Co., Ltd. of Japan, and his party visited Rungna People's Pleasure Park.
					 The guests went round various parts of the park including dolphinarium, wading pool and funfair, being briefed on the public park.
					
					 They also toured various parts of Changjon Street and enjoyed "Arirang", a grand gymnastic and artistic performance.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Central Committee of the Fatherland Front of Vietnam led by President Huing Dam visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The guests looked round the historical relics at the old home of the President in Mangyongdae, being briefed on the story associated with that old home.
					
					 The Vietnamese delegation also toured historic sites on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 The head of the delegation said Kim Il Sung was raised while receiving patriotic and revolutionary education from his parents from his childhood, adding: 
					
					 I get to know well about his revolutionary career.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung together with President Ho Chi Minh provided the friendship between the two countries.
					
					 Kim Il Sung was a close friend of the Vietnamese people.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Ssuksom Revolutionary Site, the Party Founding Memorial Tower and the Rungna People's Pleasure Park and enjoyed the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang".

articles.title: Participants in 8th Pyongyang Int'l Book Fair Pay Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Participants in 8th Pyongyang Int'l Book Fair Pay Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 8th Pyongyang International Scientific and Technological Book Fair laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill before paying tribute on Monday.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations Leave Here
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations Leave Here
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The military delegation of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba led by its Vice-Minister Joaquin Quintas Sola and the delegation of the Commission for Propaganda and Training Affairs of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party led by Vice-Chairman Sisouk Philavong left here for home on Monday.
					 Leaving here on the same day were Osvaldo Napoli, chairman of the Committee for the Development of Relations and Cooperation with the DPRK of the Parliament who is vice-president of the Parliamentary Group of the Popular Liberty of the Chamber of Deputies of Italy, and his party.

articles.title: Memorandum of DPRK Foreign Ministry Distributed as Official Document at UNSC
articles.content:
Memorandum of DPRK Foreign Ministry Distributed as Official Document at UNSC
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- A memorandum of the DPRK Foreign Ministry "U.S. hostile policy toward DPRK is chief obstacle to settlement of nuclear issue of Korean Peninsula" was distributed as an official document (S/2012/680) at the UN Security Council on Sept. 7.

articles.title: 8th Pyongyang International Scientific and Technological Book Fair Opens
articles.content:
8th Pyongyang Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair Opens
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The 8th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair was opened with due ceremony at the Grand People's Study House on Monday.
					 On display at the fair hall were latest scientific and technological books and data presented by more than 50 organizations of at least 20 countries including the DPRK, China, New Zealand, Russia, Germany, Mongolia, the U.S., Brazil, Singapore, Australia, Japan and France and regions, organizations of overseas Koreans, international organizations, individuals, embassies of different countries and missions of international organizations here.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, teachers and researchers.
					
					 Also present there were delegations and delegates of various countries and international organizations and overseas Koreans, diplomatic envoys of different countries and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 The participants paid tribute to the marble statue of President Kim Il Sung at the house.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairwoman of the organizing committee of the fair, made an opening address.
					
					 She said that the fair opened under the care of the government of the DPRK would help develop the friendly and cooperative relations among peoples of different countries and contribute to achieving mankind's progress and prosperity.
					
					 Yan Xiaohong, vice director-general of the General Administration of Press and Publication of China who is heading the delegation of Chinese publishers, in a congratulatory speech said that the Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair is contributing to promoting the scientific and technological development and boosting cooperation among countries.
					
					 At the end of the opening ceremony the participants looked round the books and data on display.

articles.title: Reception Given for Participants in Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair
articles.content:
Reception Given for Participants in Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The organizing committee of the 8th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair and the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries hosted a reception for the participants in the fair at the People's Palace of Culture Monday.
					 Present there on invitation were delegations and delegates of various countries, international bodies and overseas compatriots and staff members of foreign embassies and missions of international bodies here.
					
					 Also attending the reception were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairwoman of the organizing committee of the fair, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: National Martial Arts Championship Closes
articles.content:
National Martial Arts Championship Closes
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The 7th National Martial Arts Championship for September 10 Prize closed with due ceremony at the Taekwon-do Hall on Monday. It was opened here on Sept. 4.
					 The players made success contributable to developing the national martial arts by giving free rein to their mental power and technique.
					
					 At the championship the Pyongyang city Taekwon-do team placed first in team standings.

articles.title: Ceremony for Donating Educational Facilities and Naming Friendship Classroom Held
articles.content:
Ceremony for Donating Educational Equipment and Naming Friendship Classroom Held
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- A ceremony was held on Monday for donating educational equipment sent by Beijing Foreign Languages University of China (BFLU) to Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies (PUFS) and for naming a classroom at PUFS a DPRK-China Friendship Classroom.
					 Present there were Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association who is vice-chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned and other teaching staff and students of PUFS, Ambassador Liu Hongcai and staff members of the Chinese embassy here, members of the delegations of BFLU, the Association for Promotion of Development of Chinese Culture and the Liaoning Provincial Association for International Friendly Contact.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The speakers said the friendly relations provided by the leaders of elder generations of the two countries are growing under the deep care of their supreme leaders.
					
					 PUFS and BFLU have deepened their friendship through mutual visits and exchanges for cooperation, they added.
					
					 They expressed belief that the donated educational equipment and the friendship classroom would accelerate friendly exchanges and cooperation between the two universities and contribute to the development of the DPRK-China friendly relations.
					
					 The participants looked round the donated equipment and friendship classroom.

articles.title: 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival to Be Held
articles.content:
13th Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival to Be Held 
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival is to be held here.
					 Films from 20 odd countries will be screened during the festival from Sept. 20 to 27.
					
					 The festival will be held, divided into various panels including competition of documentary, short and long films, special screening, circular screening and film-exchange meeting.
					
					 Also scheduled in the festival is a preview of Korean films.
					
					 The festival will offer a good occasion for the movie persons of various countries to share successes and experience they have gained in producing films, boost exchange and cooperation and accelerate the development of progressive film arts in the idea of independence, friendship and peace.

articles.title: Revolutionary Song Inspires Korean People
articles.content:
Revolutionary Song Inspires Korean People
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Song "I Will Remain Your Son Forever", a theme song of Korean feature film "Don't Wait for Us" created in Juche 73 (1984), is nowadays popular among the people in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, inspiring them to fully display Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					 The song depicts the motherland as a tree and a throbbing heart, and one's own body as a leaf in the tree and a drop of blood in the heart.
					
					 It emotionally sings of the self-sacrificing spirit of the airmen of the Korean People's Army, who drove their planes into the enemies' warships, leaving the words "Don't wait for us", in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953).
					
					 With this song the Korean army and people have devoted themselves to the drive for brining a heyday of national prosperity. By dint of the self-sacrificing spirit, they put the nation's industry on a CNC basis and built many edifices of eternal value throughout the country in a short span of time, including the Taegyedo Tideland, Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, Mansudae and Changjon streets and Rungna People's Pleasure Park.
					
					 The song will as ever encourage them to fully display a strong sense of patriotism in the general onward movement for building a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Kim Un Hwa, Top Scorer at 2012 U-20 Women's World Cup
articles.content:
Kim Un Hwa, Top Scorer at 2012 U-20 Women's World Cup
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Un Hwa of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea was awarded a gold boot at the 2012 U-20 Women's World Cup.
					 Her first goal was made in the first group round-robin match with Norway, when she headed a ball right into the net, and it was followed by another five goals in the match with Argentina.
					
					 She also scored a goal in the match with Canada with a 16-meter shot at around 33rd minute, which made her the top scorer in the tournament with seven goals in all.
					
					 The 19-year-old girl is now active at the Wolmido Sports Team in the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats in Building Unified, Sovereign State
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats in Building Unified, Sovereign State
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- On the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (September 9), its people pay the highest tribute to President Kim Il Sung, who performed undying feats in building an independent and sovereign state in Korea after its liberation from Japan's colonial rule.
					 Soon after Korea's liberation, the United States occupied south Korea by force and enforced colonial enslavement policy in it. The policy led to laying hurdles to building a unified, sovereign state in the whole of Korea.
					
					 Under such grave situation, the President advanced the line of establishing a unified state through nationwide general elections.
					
					 Prompted by his noble patriotic will, representatives of political parties and social organizations in the north and the south of Korea launched a campaign to establish a unified and sovereign state in reaction to the moves for separate elections and separate government under way in south Korea.
					
					 However, the U.S. imperialists and the Syngman Rhee puppet clique of south Korea carried out the "May 10 separate elections" in disregard of the entire nation's desire.
					
					 In June Juche 37 (1948), the President convened a conference of leaders of political parties and social organizations in the north and the south of Korea and delivered a report "On the Political Situation in Our Country after the Separate Elections in South Korea and Measures to Win National Reunification". 
					
					 He, in the report, underlined the need to set up without delay an all-Korea supreme legislative body representing the Korean people's will, adopt the DPRK constitution and found an all-Korea government comprised of representatives of north and south Korean political parties and social organizations.
					
					 At the 5th Session of the People's Assembly of North Korea, he expounded characters and features of the DPRK constitution.
					
					 On Sep. 9 that year, he founded the DPRK, a representation of all Koreans' will and desire.
					
					 The founding dealt a heavy blow to the separatists and gave impetus to the movement for national reunification.

articles.title: National Anthem Created under Guidance of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
National Anthem Created under Guidance of Kim Il Sung
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- On the 64th birthday of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, its people are looking back upon the history covered by the DPRK along with its national anthem.
					 The national anthem instills the people with pride as Kim Il Sung's nation and ardent patriotism and fans up their zeal to devotedly work for prosperity of the country.
					
					 After the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule, President Kim Il Sung paid big efforts to creating this song.
					
					 When meeting musicians one day in September Juche 35 (1946), he proposed creating a national anthem in representation of freedom and happiness enjoyed by the people in the liberated country. He said that the song should represent the Korean people' national pride in having a beautiful country and splendid traditions.
					
					 What he said that day became the words of the song.
					
					 On a June day in 1947, he attended a hearing session of the national anthem.
					
					 Listening to the song carefully, he said that Korea is a time-honored country with brilliant culture and, accordingly, the verse on such theme should be repeated in the song to bring into bolder relief the sense of national pride.
					
					 Thus, the song was created under the deep care of the President. It is one of the reminders of his great feats for the country and the people.

articles.title: Pengnian Light Action Inaugurated in DPRK
articles.content:
Pengnian Light Action Inaugurated in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- A ceremony for inaugurating the Pengnian Light Action in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea took place at the Pyongyang Ophthalmology Hospital on Monday. 
					 The action has been conducted only in China. The China Hong Kong Yu Pengnian Charity Foundation made a decision to launch it in the DPRK with a view to contributing to the development of traditional friendship between the two countries. 
					
					 Through the action, the Foundation has so far rendered free medical services to hundreds of thousands of Chinese people with cataract, bringing eyesight to them, carried on relief activities for disaster-hit and poverty-stricken people and disseminated medical science and technologies.
					
					 Attending the ceremony were medical workers of the hospital and members of the medical delegation of the Foundation.
					
					 Vice-Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk in his congratulatory address expressed gratitude to Chairman of the Foundation Yu Pengnian and members of its delegation for having worked out a cooperation plan for free treatment of cataract in the DPRK and paid sincere efforts to its implementation.
					
					 "We believe that the Pengnian Light Action will help cure many cataract patients," he said, adding that the Foundation's activities will mark an important occasion in furthering the exchanges and cooperation between the two countries in health service.
					
					 Peng Zhibing, secretary to the Foundation chairman, said in a congratulatory speech that they considered it a high pride to contribute to curing cataract patients in the DPRK. The DPRK Ministry of Public Health's cooperation with the Foundation is a great encouragement and support to its work for injecting vitality into the people's life by improving their health, Peng said.
					
					 Then a briefing on the Foundation was given at the ceremony.
					
					 Peng told KCNA:
					
					 "The Foundation has planned to treat cataract cases in the DPRK from months ago.
					
					 We intend to aid surgical operations on 400 patients this time and will continue such kind of cooperation in the future.
					
					 I am sure that our activities, in cooperation with the DPRK Ministry of Public Health, will bear desirable fruits."

articles.title: Meeting of Koreans Held in China
articles.content:
Meeting of Koreans Held in China 
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- A meeting of Koreans in China was held at the DPRK embassy in Beijing in celebration of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK on Sept. 8.
					 Present there were Jo Yong Hwan, chairman of the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China, and compatriots there.
					
					 Before the meeting they laid a floral basket in front of portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A congratulatory message to the dear respected Kim Jong Un was adopted in the name of the regional association at the meeting.

articles.title: DPRK Will Invariably Adhere to Idea of Foreign Policy: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Will Invariably Adhere to Idea of Foreign Policy: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has developed the relations of friendship with all countries of the world that respect its sovereignty under the uplifted banner of independence, friendship and peace, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The history taught the truth that the people's aspiration and desire to live and develop independently could be realized only through an independent policy. 
					
					 The DPRK fully supports the people of all countries in their just cause against imperialists' domination and subjugation.
					
					 The DPRK has advanced along the road of independence, Songun and socialism, encourageing the progressive people's struggle for global independence.
					
					 The Korean people value peace but will never allow the nation's dignity and the country's sovereignty to be infringed upon. 
					
					 It is quite natural that the DPRK has done everything possible to ensure peace and security on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The DPRK has invariably adhered to the foreign policy to develop friendly relations with the world people.
					
					 The DPRK government considers the principle of mutual respect for other's sovereignty, non-interference in other's internal affairs, equality and mutual benefits as a basic principle of developing friendly and cooperative relations with other countries.
					
					 Steadfast are the stand and will of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government to consistently preserve the idea of its foreign policy -- independence, peace and friendship.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever remain true to the idea and positively contribute to the independent development of the world, the article concludes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Regime for Toeing U.S. Policy of Aggression towards DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Regime for Toeing U.S. Policy of Aggression towards DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Lee Myung Bak regime is a group of wicked traitors as it plays the role of servants for outside forces in a war against the DPRK, toeing the U.S. policy of aggression against it, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The situation remains tenser than ever before on the Korean Peninsula because the Lee group is working hard to provoke a war against the DPRK, zealously pursuant to the U.S. criminal policy of aggression against it.
					
					 The U.S. worked out and announced a new report what it called "stratagem for relations" between south Korea and the U.S. right after the Lee group came to power. To this end, the U.S. called on south Korea to introduce new-type "Patriot" missiles and join in establishing the missile defense system, etc., talking about "threat from the north". Moreover, it called for joint counteraction not only against "military threat" but against natural disasters.
					
					 The Lee group was obviously aware that all this was part of the U.S. scenario to realize its strategy against the DPRK by using south Korea as a shock brigade. Nevertheless, it zealously followed its U.S. master in its scenario, announcing a "policy toward the north" aimed at confrontation with compatriots and frantically stepping up its moves for a war against the north. 
					
					 This proves that the Lee group has finished its preparations for mobilizing all manpower and material resources in south Korea to carry out the U.S. strategy for a war against the DPRK and is now in the process of verifying its effectiveness through large-scale war maneuvers with the U.S.
					
					 There is no option but to wage a great war for reunification against the Lee group as it is hell bent on hideous provocations and moves for a war against the DPRK in collusion with foreign forces in denial of the north-south declarations, the article concludes.

articles.title: S. Korean Mandarin's Outbursts Snubbed
articles.content:
S. Korean Mandarin's Outbursts Snubbed 
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The vice-minister of Unification of south Korea was reported recently to have talked nonsense at a seminar at the "National Assembly" that "the north's nuclear development and military provocations weakened the public support for the south-north economic cooperation".
					 He cried out for the "north's sincere attitude," talking about "a new groundwork for south-north relations". 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: 
					
					 What he uttered is nothing but sophism that can be let loose only by the south Korean "government" authorities who are accustomed to make profound confusion of right and wrong and incite confrontation.
					
					 The commentary cites facts to prove how these confrontation maniacs brought the north-south relations to a total collapse and aggravated the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the worst phase of tension.
					
					 The south Korean regime is not a partner for cooperation with the DPRK but a criminal to be severely punished, the commentary notes, adding:
					
					 The Lee regime, which worked hard to realize its dream of invading the DPRK in reliance on foreign forces is now busy passing the buck for the frozen north-south relations to others, taken aback by the determination of the army and people of the DPRK to blow up the dens of crimes and settle accounts with it through a great war for national reunification.
					
					 No matter how desperately the Lee regime may try to save its totally bankrupt policy of confrontation and get rid of the abyss of ruin, it will get it nowhere.
					
					 The regime would be well advised to stop talking nonsense and wait for a severe judgment by history.

articles.title: Minju Joson Exposes Intention of Remnants of "Yusin" in Eulogizing Park Chung-Hee
articles.content:
Minju Joson Exposes Intention of Remnants of "Yusin" in Eulogizing Park Chung-Hee
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Recently disclosed was a paper on which traitor Park Chung-Hee, "yusin" dictator, swore in blood his loyalty to Japanese imperialism in 1939.
					 Minju Joson Monday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The heinous pro-Japanese traitor's nature was brought to light once again.
					
					 It was a tragedy of history and shame on the nation that the special class pro-Japanese lackey and traitor took the power and ruled south Korea for 18 years under the manipulation of the U.S.
					
					 Immeasurable was misfortune suffered by the south Korean people due to the fascist crackdown by Park Chung-Hee. It is by no means fortuitous that the south Korean people are shuddering even at the word of "yusin regime".
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean political circle is now praising the pro-U.S. and pro-Japanese traitor and eulogizing his blood-stained fascist rule in public. This burlesque was orchestrated by those who have prolonged their lives in reliance on "yusin". These remnants of "yusin" have defended the "May 16 military coup" that stroke down the achievements of the April 19 popular uprising as the "decision for national salvation". They even justified the "yusin" system aimed at the fabrication of "two Koreas" and long-term stay in power with the ungrounded "economic growth". Their intention is to paint the "yusin" dictator as "patriot" and use his name in setting up the second "yusin regime".
					
					 The disclosure of traitor Park Chung-Hee's loyalty paper in blood at a time when the "presidential election" is drawing nearer, has pushed the clan of the "Saenuri Party" including remnants of "yusin" into a tight corner. In particular, the daughter of the "yusin" dictator has suffered most.
					
					 The crimes committed by the "yusin" dictator against the nation should be judged down through generations.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses Lee and Park of Ridiculous Huddle
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses Lee and Park of Ridiculous Huddle 
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak and Park Geun Hye of south Korea were reported recently to have held an exclusive huddle in a back room of Chongwadae. No wonder, Lee, the worst traitor, and Park, an offspring of dictatorship and conservative forces, were closeted together.
					 It is not hard to guess what they discussed at this huddle except for ways for the conservative forces' stay in power as they became partners just for political reasons.
					
					 They, feeling guilty conscience, let a person concerned of Chongwadae loose rhetoric that they "discussed mainly outstanding issues related to people's living including economy and public peace rather than political matters." This is nothing but a silly talk. It is clear from the fact that the huddle was requested by Park.
					
					 As she kicked off her "presidential election" campaign with political burlesques under such mottos as "Serve in a war as a commoner" and "Form a new party", she must have used the recent huddle as an occasion for advertising her feats and colluding with Lee for a large alliance of conservative forces.
					
					 As known, Park toured various parts of south Korea under the spurious signboard of "large integration of people" after being selected as a "presidential" candidate from the "Saenuri Party" in August. But her "campaign for concord" regardless of "idea, stratum, region, generation, industrialization and democratization" was coolly treated and rebuffed by people of various social standings wherever she went for being a campaign of conservative for the revival of dictatorship against democracy and progress. It invited accusation and ridicule even from the ruling party and conservative forces due to Park's stand on the "yusin" dictatorship and the present one-person dictatorial system and hideous scandals of her confidants. 
					
					 It was "supported and welcomed" only by the descendants of such thrice-cursed traitors as Syngman Rhee and Park Chung-Hee and ultra-right conservatives including human scum Kim Young Sam.
					
					 For instance, a son of Kim Young Sam uttered words of "strong support" and clarified his will to cooperate with her, saying "he was pleased to hear her advocate a large alliance of conservatives".
					
					 As seen above, Park Geun Hye's on-going "presidential election" campaign and her recent visit to Chongwadae for huddle with Lee are aimed to achieve the aims of the conservative forces, to all intents and purposes.
					
					  Lee Myung Bak who is staking his fate on the conservative forces after his retirement from office must feel very grateful for her gesture.
					
					 The developments go to prove that "the large integration of people" touted by Park is aimed at seeking the dictatorial regime's stay in power through the large alliance of conservative forces. This gives the lie to Park's hypocritical talk about "keeping a distance from the Lee regime" and "revamping"
					
					 It was around this time two years ago that Lee praised Park, uttering: "We are in the single-minded relationship which does not require any explanation." And Park on her part proposed a toast to the "success of the Lee regime", saying "reemergence of power depends on the success of the present regime". Recollecting all this makes it clear what Park will seek in the days ahead.
					
					 If the south Korean people from all walks life do not wish to see the repetition of the five years of nightmare, they should not be taken in by the chicanery of Lee and the clan of the "Saenuri Party" but make a clean sweep of the conservative group including the descendants of "yusin".

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams U.S.-Japan Collusion over Radar Deployment
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams U.S.-Japan Collusion over Radar Deployment
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. announced its plan to deploy a new radar system in Japan under the pretext of "a missile threat" from the DPRK.
					 The chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff at a recent interview with the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff of the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" discussed the issue of deploying another early warning radar in Japan. 
					
					 The U.S. had already integrated the patrol and reconnaissance unit command and the first patrol and reconnaissance flying corps of the Pacific Fleet into a new intelligence unit and deployed it in the U.S. military base in Misawa, Aomori Prefecture, Japan. EA-18G Growler electronic warfare plane of the U.S. Navy was transferred to the Misawa base from the U.S. mainland. It was reported that the plane is capable of jamming enemies' waves to disturb their radar network. As a result, the true objective of the Misawa base is being brought into bolder relief as a base for espionage and plot-breeding operations whose basic mission is to monitor the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. is contemplating building high performance radars in two other places for detecting ballistic missiles and reinforcing and deploying the U.S. Marines in Okinawa, Japan. The above-said collusion between the U.S. and Japan is aimed to quickly round off the MD in the Asia-Pacific region through the deployment of a new radar system.
					
					 A spokesman for the U.S. State Department, when recently answering the question as to the U.S. promotion of the expansion of the MD in East Asia, said that it is to cope with "the missile threat from north Korea".
					
					 The "missile threat" touted by the U.S. is unanimously censured by the world as a deceptive move to justify its MD.
					
					 The U.S. final aim is to secure an unlimited capability for attacking countries in the Asia-Pacific region through the expansion of the MD, attain the unchallenged military edge and thus dominate it.
					
					 The MD which has entered the phase of deployment for an actual war through the collusion between the U.S. and Japan has vast areas of Asia including the Korean Peninsula, the Northeastern region of China and the Far East region of Russia within the range of its strikes.
					
					 The U.S. plan to build a missile shield includes not only Northeast Asia but the Mideast, Europe and other vast regions of the world. Its scenario is to lay siege to big powers of the Eurasian continent and build missile shields of various classes in a bid to mount missile attacks from all sides in "contingency." 
					
					 Its missile threat is wrecking the world peace and security and sparking off discord and military contradiction among countries.
					
					 The MD should be checked at once.

articles.title: DPRK Anniversary Marked in Beijing
articles.content:
DPRK Anniversary Marked in Beijing
						
 Beijing, September 9 (KCNA) -- The Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association gave a reception in Beijing on Sept. 7  to celebrate the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Present there on invitation were Ambassador Ji Jae Ryong and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Beijing.
					
					 Present there were Wu Donghe, chairman of the China－Korea Friendship Association, Peng Zuoku, vice-president of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries, officials in various fields including the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC), the Ministry of National Defense and the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries.
					
					 Wu Donghe said in his speech that the Korean people have achieved laudable successes in socialist construction under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and the Workers' Party of Korea over the past 64 years.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The Korean people have exerted efforts for the building of a thriving nation, thus achieving successes in economic development, in the efforts to improve the people's living standard and the expansion of exchange with other countries by displaying the spirit of fortitude, rallied close around First Secretary Kim Jong Un and the WPK.
					
					 It is the steadfast strategic policy of the CPC and the government to steadily boost the Sino-DPRK relations of good neighborliness, friendship and cooperation.
					
					 The Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations are expanding to wide fields and the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship will shine forever generation after generation under the common concern of the two leaders.
					
					 Ji Jae Ryong referred to the founding and development of the DPRK by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, adding that immortal feats performed by the peerlessly great men will shine forever along with prosperous Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Their ideals are being put into practice under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche started in Mt. Paektu is sure to be accomplished generation after generation thanks to the invincible revolutionary forces and the ranks of all service personnel and people rallied single-mindedly around Kim Jong Un, peerlessly brilliant commander.
					
					 Reiterating the will of the Korean people to make positive efforts to develop the DPRK-China friendly relations together with Chinese comrades, he expressed belief that the Chinese people would successfully greet the 18th Congress of the CPC.

articles.title: Korean Book Exhibition Held in China
articles.content:
Korean Book Exhibition Held in China
 Beijing, September 9 (KCNA) -- A Korean book exhibition took place here to celebrate the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Displayed in its venue were works of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, books on their undying feats, books introducing the DPRK and books on various fields.
					
					 An opening ceremony of the exhibition was held on September 7.
					
					 Present there were officials of the General Administration of Press and Publication of China, State Nationalities Affairs Commission, Nationalities Publishing House and Central University for Nationalities and other officials concerned, members of the delegation of the Korea Publications Import and Export Company and the delegation of the Social Science Book Publishing House and an official of the DPRK embassy in Beijing.
					
					 Speeches were made at the opening ceremony.
					
					 The president and editor-in-chief of the Nationalities Publishing House of China and other speakers said that the exhibition would be of important significance in promoting understanding between the two peoples, deepening friendship and boosting exchange in the press fields.
					
					 Books will help Chinese people get deeper understanding of the DPRK and learn the long history and brilliant culture of Korea, they noted.
					
					 The two peoples have long supported and helped each other and deepened friendship, they said, expressing their will to steadily develop the Sino-DPRK friendship through book and press exchange and academic researches.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in China
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" was published in a pamphlet by           Longshan printing house in Dandong of China on Sept. 4.
					 The work, made public on Sept. 5, 2008, clarifies in detail that the might of the invincible DPRK is ensured when President Kim Il Sung's idea of Juche-oriented nation-building and feats performed by him in it are upheld, preserved and eternally glorified.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Peruvian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Peruvian Paper
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "On Correctly Understanding the Originality of Kimilsungism" was carried by the August special issue of Accion Nacionalista, a Peruvian paper.
					 The work, published on Oct. 2, 1976, clarifies that Kimilsungism has its system of Juche-oriented ideology, theories and methods as it is an original idea that cannot be explained within the framework of Marxism-Leninism in its contents and composition.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Carried on Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Carried on Foreign Papers
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The detailed gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People" was carried by the Sept. 4 issue of La Prosperite, a paper of Democratic Congo.
					 The work, made public on April 20, 2012 clarifies the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in their lifetimes. It also indicates the tasks for firmly upholding and eternally glorifying their ideas and feats.
					
					 The main contents of his work "Let Us Effect Kim Jong Il's Patriotism and Step Up the Building of a Prosperous Country" was carried by Kuwait Times on Sept. 4.
					
					 The work, published on July 26, 2012, clarifies the essence of Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his life characterized by his ardent love for the country and its people.
					
					 It also clarifies important issues arising in embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: Revolutionary Activities of Kim Jong Un Introduced Abroad
articles.content:
Revolutionary Activities of Kim Jong Un Introduced Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The news of revolutionary activities of the dear respected Kim Jong Un was given publicity in various countries on Sept. 6 and 7.
					 The Lao news agency reported in detail his field guidance to the Taedonggang Tile Factory built on an expansion basis.
					
					 The Indian paper Statesman and the Internet homepage of the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship conveyed news of his visits to families that moved to new flats in Changjon Street, illustrated with photos.
					
					 The Nepalese paper Arpan reported that Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un inspected the Thrice Three-Revolution Red Flag Kamnamu Company (a company under persimmon trees) under KPA Unit 4302.
					
					 It also reported that he visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces on his way back after wrapping up his inspection of the eastern sector of the front. Photos on his revolutionary activities were given by the paper

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK Marked in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK Marked in Foreign Countries 
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Diverse events took place in different countries in celebration of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK between Aug. 30 and Sept. 3.
					 They included a meeting held in Frimasons Hall in New Delhi of India, seminars, book and photo exhibitions and film shows by the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung and the Indian Society for the Study of Works of Kim Jong Il and lectures by the Sogd Regional Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, in Kinshasa House of Culture of Ministry of Culture of Democratic Congo and by the Gikopress Group of Guinea. 
					
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were photos showing undying feats President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed for founding and strengthening the DPRK and the revolutionary activities of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were DPRK books including works of the President and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Speakers including the chairman of the Deli Rural Developing Bureau of India, the secretary of the Deli State Committee of the Indian National Congress Party and the director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea noted that such a great man as the President is born only once in several centuries, highly praising his feats in the nation-building.
					
					 They noted that Kim Jong Il defended the dignity and sovereignty of the nation and the country by dint of Songun and turned the DPRK into a great power which no one dares provoke.
					
					 The chairman of the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung said that it was thanks to the indefatigable efforts of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il that the DPRK has covered the path of steady development since it was founded.
					
					 Kurbonzyon Mirzoyeva, member of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, said that a vigorous drive to build an economic power is under way in the DPRK and the desire of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to build a thriving nation is now becoming a brilliant reality thanks to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A message of greeting and a letter to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events held in India.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Laud Feats of Kim Il Sung in Nation-building
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Laud Feats of Kim Il Sung in Nation-building
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers dedicated special write-ups to the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Democratic Congo newspaper La Prosperite on Sept. 4 carried articles entitled "Kim Il Sung, Founder of DPRK" and "Korean People Mark Sept. 9, the 64th birthday of DPRK" illustrated with a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The paper said that the President performed undying feats in founding and developing the DPRK and devoted himself to the building of an independent and powerful socialist state all his life.
					
					 Under the wise leadership of the President the Korean people could lead a worthwhile and happy life in socialist Korea.
					
					 The Cambodian paper Kmae Amata on Sept. 3 ran an article "Celebration of 64th anniversary of DPRK" accompanied with a photo of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing together.
					
					 The paper noted that the DPRK is an independent powerful state.
					
					 In recent years, the international community could know well how strong its independent stance is through the facts that it frustrated all sorts of moves of its enemies to deter it from launching a satellite, the legitimate right of a sovereign state.
					
					 The Bangladeshi newspaper Natun Katha on Sept. 4 noted in an article titled "People's country" that it was the view of the President that if the will and wishes of the people are fully reflected and systematized, they precisely become an idea and line and policies.
					
					 Noting that the DPRK is bringing about a decisive turn in improving the people's living standard and building a thriving nation by putting spurs to light industry and agriculture, the paper expressed conviction that the DPRK would prosper.

articles.title: Chinese, Russian Media Report Statement of DPRK Foreign Ministry
articles.content:
Chinese, Russian Media Report Statement of DPRK Foreign Ministry 
						
 Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- China and Russia reported on Sept. 7 and 8 the statement issued by the DPRK foreign ministry on the 67th anniversary of U.S. troops' occupation of south Korea.
					 Xinhua News Agency said that the DPRK foreign ministry spokesman released a statement demanding U.S. troops pull out of south Korea, continuing:
					
					 The DPRK has been the first target of the U.S. armed forces present in south Korea for more than half a century since GIs occupied it.
					
					 The country could not but build a nuclear deterrent to cope with the increasing threat from the biggest nuclear weapons state in the world.
					
					 The U.S. military presence in south Korea not only turned the Korean Peninsula into the biggest hotspot in the world but has now become a vicious tumor-like entity gravely threatening the peace and stability of Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					  The U.S. forces in south Korea have become forward-deployed forces and "strategic mobile forces" whose nature and role are to contain the region and hold military hegemony in the region.  
					
					 The U.S. military presence in south Korea is a vivid expression of the U.S. hostile policy toward DPRK.
					
					 The spokesman warned that if the U.S. seeks to keep its forces in south Korea contrary to the unanimous desire of the regional people, it had better get itself ready to experience an all-out war with the DPRK. 
					
					 ITAR-TASS also made a similar report.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un presencia funcion del Conjunto Artistico del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un presencia funcion del Conjunto Artistico del EPC
						
Pyongyang, 10 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio la funcion del Conjunto Artistico del EPC dedicada al 64o aniversario de la fundacion de la RPDC.
					A traves del espectaculo, los ejecutantes cantaron la orgullosa trayectoria de la RPDC que bajo la guia del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente           Kim Jong Il, recorrio durante mas de 60 anos la gloriosa senda de independencia, el Songun y el socialismo escribiendo la historia de victorias y cambios.
					
					La funcion demostro que todos los militares y habitantes, que se convencieron en sus vivencias de la superioridad del regimen socialista, defenderan hasta el final esta valiosa cuna de felicidad superando cualesquier pruebas y dificultades que afronten.
					
					Los espectadores tomaron la firme decision de luchar firmemente por construir sin falta el Estado prospero socialista del Juche siguiendo la direccion del Mariscal.
					
					Presenciaron la funcion Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Ki Nam, Pak To Chun, Kim Jong Gak, Yang Hyong Sop, Hyon Chol Hae, Kim Won Hong, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Mun Kyong Dok y Ro Tu Chol, los funcionarios del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, el Consejo de Ministros, los ministerios y los organos centrales y los habitantes capitalinos de diversos estratos.

articles.title: Inaugurada feria internacional de libros de ciencias y tecnicas
articles.content:
Inaugurada feria internacional de libros de ciencias y tecnicas
						
Pyongyang, 10 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la VIII Exposicion Internacional de Libros de Ciencias y Tecnicas de Pyongyang.
					Se exhiben en la ocasion los libros de ciencias y tecnicas sofisticadas y los datos presentados por mas de 50 entidades de mas de 20 paises y regiones, tales como la RPDC, China, Nueva Zelanda, Rusia, Alemania, Mongolia, Estados Unidos, Brasil, Singapur, Australia, Japon y Francia, las entidades de coreanos en ultramar, las organizaciones internacionales, las personalidades extranjeras, las embajadas de varios paises y las representaciones de organizaciones internacionales en Corea.
					
					Tuvo lugar este lunes en el Palacio de Estudio del Pueblo la ceremonia de apertura.
					
					Tomaron parte en la ocasion Choe Thae Bok, secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, los funcionarios de ramas correspondientes, los profesores e investigadores, las delegaciones y delegados de varios paises, organizaciones internacionales y de la comunidad coreana en ultramar, los representantes diplomaticos y otros miembros de las embajadas de diversos paises en Corea.
					
					Los participantes rindieron el postumo homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung ante su estatua de marmol erguida en el Palacio de Estudio del Pueblo.
					
					Kim Jong Suk, presidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y del comite organizador de la feria, pronuncio la palabra de la ocasion.
					
					Ella senalo que la feria inaugurada bajo la atencion del gobierno coreano contribuira a desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los pueblos de varios paises y a lograr el progreso y prosperidad de la humanidad.
					
					En su discurso de felicitacion, Yan Xiaohong, subdirector general de la Administracion de Prensa y Publicacion de China, quien preside la delegacion de funcionarios chinos de imprenta, dijo que la feria de libros de Pyongyang ayuda al fomento de desarrollo cientifico-tecnico y el fortalecimiento de la cooperacion entre los paises.
					
					Terminada la ceremonia, los participantes pasaron revista a los libros y datos expuestos.

articles.title: Tiene lugar acto inaugural de accion de luz de Pengnian
articles.content:
Tiene lugar acto inaugural de accion de luz de Pengnian
						
Pyongyang, 10 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 10 en el Hospital Oftalmologo de Pyongyang el acto inaugural de la Accion de Luz de Pengnian en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					La Fundacion de Caridad Yu Pengnian de Hong Kong de China comenzo por primera vez en ultramar esa Accion, que viene realizandose en territorio chino, con el proposito de contribuir al desarrollo de las tradicionales relaciones de amistad con la RPDC.
					
					A traves de la accion, la fundacion recupero la vista de cientos de miles pacientes chinos de catarata curandolos gratuitamente y realiza las actividades de socorro a los damnificados de desastre natural y los pobres y de educacion y divulgacion de ciencias y tecnicas.
					
					En la ceremonia inaugural participaron los medicos del hospital mencionado y los miembros de la delegacion medica de dicha fundacion china.
					
					El viceministro del Salud Publica Kang Ha Guk, en su palabra de felicitacion, expreso agradecimiento al presidente Yu Pengnian y los miembros de la delegacion que trazaron el programa de cooperacion en el tratamiento gratuito de catarata en Corea y prestaron sinceros esfuerzos por ponerlo en practica.
					
					Aseguro que a traves de la accion en cuestion, recobraran la vista muchos enfermos.
					
					Senalo que el tratamiento gratuito de los pacientes de catarata por la Fundacion marcara un hito importante para fortalecer el intercambio y la cooperacion en el campo de salud publica entre ambos paises.
					
					El secretario del presidente de la Fundacion, Peng Zhibing, dijo en su discurso de felicitacion que se siente orgulloso por tener la oportunidad de contribuir al tratamiento de los pacientes coreanos cegados por la catarata.
					
					Recalco que el inicio de la accion en cooperacion con el Ministerio de Salud Publica de Corea resulta el gran estimulo y magnifico apoyo a los trabajos de la Fundacion para fomentar la vida de las personas.
					
					En la ceremonia hubo la introduccion de la fundacion.
					
					Citado por la ACNC, Peng Zhibing (41 anos de edad) dijo que desde hace varios meses, la fundacion se proponia tratar a los pacientes de catarata en Corea, y prosiguio:
					
					Esta vez, ayudaremos la operacion para mas de 400 pacientes y seguiremos ampliando la cooperacion.
					
					Estoy seguro de que dara excelentes resultados nuestra accion que se realiza con la cooperacion del MINSAP de la RPDC.

articles.title: Distribuido como documento oficial memorando de cancilleria coreana
articles.content:
Distribuido como documento oficial memorando de cancilleria coreana
						
Pyongyang, 10 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El memorando del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea "La politica hostil a la RPDC de Estados Unidos es el escollo principal para la solucion del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana" fue circulado como documento oficial S/2012/680 del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
